tool.name: bioconductor-msnbase smooth chromatogram
tool.description: smooth consecutive spectra using a moving window filter

configfiles.configfile: data_prof <- MSnbase::readMSData("$input_file", mode = "onDisk") data_smoothed <- MSnbase::combineSpectraMovingWindow( data_prof, halfWindowSize = ${halfWindowSize}, intensityFun = ${intensity_function}, mzd = 0, timeDomain = $qtof, weighted = $weighted, ppm = $ppm, BPPARAM = BiocParallel::bpparam() ) MSnbase::writeMSData( data_smoothed, file = "smoothed.mzml", copy = TRUE, outformat = "mzml" )

param.name: input_file
param.label: Input mzML File
param.help: The input mzML file containing the MSnbase data.

param.name: halfWindowSize
param.label: Half window size
param.help: The span parameter for the smoothing method.

param.name: weighted
param.label: Weighted
param.help: Whether to weight the moving average depending on the distance from the centre.

param.name: qtof
param.label: QTOF
param.help: Whether to data was acquired using a QTOF instrument.

param.label: ppm tolerance
param.help: Tolerance for which mz values are considered to belong to the same ion.

param.name: intensity_function
param.label: Function to combine intensities
param.help: Function used to combine the intensity values of the same m/z value.
